bibl.title: Letter from Michael E. Connor to Henry Rose Carter, May 28, 1923

div1.p: Connor reports that there are no cases of yellow fever yet, but the critical period will be in the summer. Connor believes yellow fever in Columbia threatens Mexico.

My dear Doctor Carter
div1.p:
Your M.S.S's- epidemiology and
history came to me today- I will take
them to Colima for in which place am
spending the greater part of June-

I am going to read epidemi-
ology first and will send you some
notes which I have been rounding out for
an article for the y. f. meeting this year-
and to this meeting the Consejo plan to
send you, Doctor Cumming and Doctor
Russell invitations. I hope that you can
come- So far we seem to be o.k. here,
but the critical period will be during
July - if nothingno case shows up by August
first I will feel that we are safe-
The confirmed presence of y. f. in Columbia
will call for supervision in Mexico
during 1924 - and for this we are
23
training bright young men here who will
be able to work with the Medico Delegados
as chief Inspectors and over-all there should
one of our present staff men to be Inspector
general to supervise their work.

Dr. Pierce has been here and made
a careful inspection in the short time
at his disposal. I have the impression
that he was very well satisfied with
all he saw - but I wish he could have
stayed longer with us-

I have underway some experiments
to try and determine the rate of “steg” in-
crease in towns where small containers
tinajos, barrels, etc are in use- and where
permanent containers, aljibes, tanks etc are used-
my hope is that a formula can be developed
that will be of service in indicating
how long we can stay out of a place-
before the deposit index will rise from
say 5% to 10% - perhaps I had better use the
house index-

I am suggesting to Doctor Russell
that we could train here some young
men for the Brazilian field-

at the end of this year I will have
to ask the Board for a detail where I can
take my family, Mrs Connor find it increasing
-ly hard to handle our 3 youngsters and while
I would like to continue in y. f. field it may-
be necessary to give way - am taking up the
questions with Doctor Russell later in the
year-
Wish all good wishes, I am,
